tabs.title: Market
list: The Indian granite market is valued at $40 billion and plays a significant role in the economies of states like Andhra Pradesh and Tamil Nadu.

Granite remains one of the most valued natural stones due to its durability, versatility, and aesthetic appeal. Midwest is recognized globally for its Black Galaxy Granite, contributing 35% of India’s total Black Galaxy granite exports.
Midwest contributes 20% of the Black Galaxy granite production in India, holding a 35% share in export volumes.
Domestic demand for granite in India grew at a 9.3% CAGR between fiscal 2022 and 2024, driven by rising demand in construction and residential sectors.
Export markets include the US, Europe, and Asia. India remains a net exporter, with granite export volumes consistently outpacing imports.

tabs.title: Growth
list: Midwest's granite operations are expected to grow significantly with expanding reserves and continued market leadership. Granite production is projected to see a CAGR of 12%, driven by Midwest’s leadership in the Black Galaxy segment.
Domestic demand for granite is projected to grow at a 6-7% CAGR through fiscal 2029, fuelled by the housing and construction sectors.
Rajasthan leads production, accounting for 57% of total granite output in fiscal 2024. Overall granite production is expected to reach 24,366-25,537 KT by fiscal 2029.
Black granite, especially Black Galaxy, is projected to see increased demand, growing at a CAGR of 8-11% by fiscal 2029.

content.text: Midwest has begun a shift from diesel to electricity and solar power in its granite mining operations, reducing greenhouse gas emissions.
Electrification of machinery and the use of solar power plants have decreased dependency on non-renewable resources.
Solar power plants have been installed to meet energy needs, reducing carbon footprint and enhancing energy resilience.
Midwest employs rainwater harvesting at its granite mining pits, creating an onsite water supply and contributing to groundwater recharge, reducing the need for external water sources.
Eco-friendly overburden management ensures responsible disposal of waste rock. Post-mining rehabilitation includes terracing and the development of green belts, improving local biodiversity.
Dust suppression measures, including water sprinkling systems and advanced drilling techniques, minimize environmental impact.
